item.title: Report E-2024050014
item.description:
Report E-2024050014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of material released from one (1) 100-pound cardboard box due to a rip against the trailer wall during offloading. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the released material and containerized the recovered material into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the spent PPE. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041202
item.description:
Report X-2024041202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING PROPER PPE AND USING THE UPDATED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE UNLOAD. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS OBSERVED TO BE LEAKING A SMALL AMOUNT OF WHITE POWDER. RESPONDER PROMPTLY AND SAFELY CLEANED UP THE POWDER AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION/PROCESSING.
